alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 7:59PM CDT until July 06 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Grant County in southwestern Wisconsin... * Until 200 AM CDT Wednesday. * At 759 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boscobel, Fennimore, Preston, Montfort, Centerville, Mount Ida, Millville, Woodman, Stitzer, Werley, Annaton, and Red Oak Ridge. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
